intro: Holosetum, commonly known as the common hollyhock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, velvety flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has palmate leaves that are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs. It is native to Europe and Asia but is widely cultivated in temperate regions around the world. Holosetum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and borders.
